Ar Mo Bhealach FÃ©in Episode 1
SeÃ¡n Mac LabhraÃ­ retraces Donegal author Seosamh Mac Grianna's epic 300-mile hike through Wales in 1934. In episode one, SeÃ¡n undertakes the first part of his journey from Cardiff to the coalfields of the Rhondda valley.
Using Mac Grianna's book 'Mo Bhealach FÃ©in' as a guide, SeÃ¡n learns about Wales, past and present, and tries to understand why Ireland's greatest Gaelic novelist undertook this arduous journey through some of the most spectacular scenery in Britain.

Ar Mo Bhealach FÃ©in Episode 3
SeÃ¡n Mac LabhraÃ­ retraces Donegal author Seosamh Mac Grianna's epic 300-mile hike through Wales in 1934. Using Mac Grianna's book 'Mo Bhealach FÃ©in' as a guide, the final episode sees SeÃ¡n making his way from Bala to Cardiff following the last part of Seosamh Mac Grianna's trek.
On the way he has an audience with a Welsh bard, experiences the massive cultural event that is the Eisteddfod and reflects on how the journey influenced Mac Grianna's life and work.
